intro: Pilosella flagellaris subsp. besnikensis, commonly known as the Besnik's hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphology, including the shape and arrangement of its leaves and inflorescences. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species within its native range.
